identificationModule.briefTitle: Analysis of Risk Factors for Surgical Site Infections in Patients With Acute Abdomen at Hospital of State University of Haiti
identificationModule.officialTitle: Risk Factors Associated With the Occurrence of Surgical Site Infections (SSI) in Patients Operated for Acute Abdomen at Hôpital de l'Université d'Etat d'Haiti (HUEH) From January 2018 to December 2020

descriptionModule.briefSummary: The purpose of this study is to identify the risk factors associated with surgical site infection.
descriptionModule.detailedDescription: 87 patients medical records from January 2018 to December 2020 will be analyzed to detect the risk factors linked to the occurence of surgical site infection. Then the strength of their association with surgical site infection will be determined via multivariate analysis.

armGroups.label: Case
armGroups.description: Patients who developed surgical site infection.

armGroups.label: Controls
armGroups.description: Patients who did not developed surgical site infection.

primaryOutcomes.description: Wheter or not patients developed surgical site infection

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Female or male patients over 12 years of age.
* Admitted to the Surgery Department for acute surgical abdomen and having undergone surgery

Exclusion Criteria:

* Patients who have undergone abdominal surgery for urological or gynecological pathologies
* Files with missing information on preoperative, operative and post-operative arrangements
eligibilityModule.studyPopulation: The participants selected in our study include those who have developed an infection at the operating site (case) as well as those who have not developed it (controls) following acute abdominal surgery diagnosed in post-op room at the surgery department of The State University of Haiti, from January 2018 to December 2022.
